008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image.access;
010
011import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
012import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
013import imagingbook.common.interpolation.PixelInterpolator.InterpolationMethod;
014
015/**
016 * A specific vector-valued image accessor for RGB images
017 * (direct subclass of {@link VectorAccessor}).
018 */
019public class RgbAccessor extends VectorAccessor {
020        
021        private final int[] pixels;
022
023        
024        public RgbAccessor(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
025                super(ip, 3, obs, ipm);
026                this.pixels = (int[]) this.ip.getPixels();
027        }
028        
029        @Override
030        ScalarAccessor makeComponentAccessor(int k) {
031                return new ComponentAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, outOfBoundsStrategy, interpolationMethod, k);
032        }
033        
034        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
035
036        @Override
037        public float[] getPix(int u, int v) { // returns an RGB value packed into a float[]
038                float red = componentAccessors[0].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
039                float grn = componentAccessors[1].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff00) >> 8;
040                float blu = componentAccessors[2].getVal(u, v);  //(c & 0xff);
041                return new float[] { red, grn, blu };
042        }
043        
044        @Override
045        public float[] getPix(double x, double y) {
046                float red = componentAccessors[0].getVal(x, y);
047                float grn = componentAccessors[1].getVal(x, y);
048                float blu = componentAccessors[2].getVal(x, y); 
049                return new float[] { red, grn, blu };
050        }
051        
052        @Override
053        public void setPix(int u, int v, float[] valf) {
054                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
055                        componentAccessors[k].setVal(u, v, valf[k]);
056                }
057        }
058        
059        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
060        
061        private interface ComponentGetter {
062                /**
063                 * Function to extract a particular RGB component from an integer.
064                 * @param rgb a packed RGB integer
065                 * @return a component value
066                 */
067                int get(int rgb); 
068        }
069        
070        private interface ComponentSetter {
071                /**
072                 * Function to insert a particular component value into an integer.
073                 * @param rgb a packed RGB integer
074                 * @param c the component value to insert
075                 * @return the modified RGB integer
076                 */
077                int set(int rgb, int c);
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Defines a scalar image accessor for one particular color component.
082         * This is a non-static inner class, which shares data with the enclosing
083         * {@link RgbAccessor} instance.
084         * Note that this subclass of {@link ScalarAccessor} has no ImageProcessor
085         * of is own, but {@link #getProcessor()} returns the original 
086         * {@link ColorProcessor} instance.
087         */
088        private class ComponentAccessor extends ScalarAccessor {
089                
090                private final int k;    // the RGB component index = 0,1,2
091                        
092                private final ComponentGetter[] getComponent = {                        // note the fancy use of lambda expressions!
093                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0xff0000) >> 16,        // extract red component
094                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0x00ff00) >> 8,         // extract green component
095                                (rgb) -> (rgb & 0x0000ff) };            // extract blue component
096                
097                private final ComponentSetter[] setComponent = {
098                                (rgb, r) -> (rgb & 0xff00ffff) | (r & 0xff) << 16,      // insert red component
099                                (rgb, g) -> (rgb & 0xffff00ff) | (g & 0xff) << 8,       // insert green component
100                                (rgb, b) -> (rgb & 0xffffff00) | (b & 0xff)                     // insert blue component
101                };
102                
103                private ComponentAccessor(ColorProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm, int k) {
104                        super(ip, obs, ipm);
105                        this.k = k;
106                }
107
108                @Override
109                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
110                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
111                        if (i < 0) {
112                                return this.defaultValue;
113                        } else {
114                                return getComponent[k].get(pixels[i]);
115                        }
116                }
117
118                @Override
119                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
120                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
121                        if (i >= 0) {
122                                int vali = clamp(Math.round(val));
123                                pixels[i] = setComponent[k].set(pixels[i], vali);
124                        }
125                }
126                
127                private int clamp(int val) {
128                        if (val < 0) return 0;
129                        if (val > 255) return 255;
130                        return val;
131                }
132        }
133
134}
